subsection_content: Eating food: people accidentally eat roundworm eggs from unwashed food, especially raw vegetables fertilized with human feces. (4); Drinking dirty water: in areas with disease sources, eggs can easily float out into ponds, lakes, etc. If this water is watered on vegetables, tubers, and fruits that people eat without washing or drink uncooked water, it is also a problem. will get sick.; Putting hands in mouth: children, when playing on contaminated soil containing pathogens, put their hands in their mouths.
subsection_title: benh giun dua.json. Transmission routes of roundworm
subsection_data:
benh giun dua.json. Transmission routes of roundworm
Eating food: people accidentally eat roundworm eggs from unwashed food, especially raw vegetables fertilized with human feces. (4); Drinking dirty water: in areas with disease sources, eggs can easily float out into ponds, lakes, etc. If this water is watered on vegetables, tubers, and fruits that people eat without washing or drink uncooked water, it is also a problem. will get sick.; Putting hands in mouth: children, when playing on contaminated soil containing pathogens, put their hands in their mouths.
